que: When was the first GPS satellite launched?  This might be earlier than you'd think...
How many GPS satellites were there when the system was originally set up?
What is the minimum number of GPS satellites you need to receive information from in order to get a fix on your horizontal position?
What kind of information does a GPS satellite transmit to the GPS receiver?
opt2: The location of the GPS satellite
opt3: The time the message was sent
opt4: The orbital information for all the other GPS satellites in the fleet

que: How is DGPS different from normal GPS?
opt1: It uses two receivers, one at a known location and one at an unknown location
opt2: It is less accurate than GPS
opt4: It is only available to professionals
ans: It uses two receivers, one at a known location and one at an unknown location

que: What is the biggest source of error for a DGPS?
opt3: Refraction in the ionosphere and troposphere

que: You see that your GPS unit is WAAS-enabled.  What's so great about WAAS?
opt1: It increases the number of locations your GPS unit can store
opt2: It improves the accuracy and precision of location measurements
opt3: It lengthens the battery life of the GPS receiver
opt4: It is an extra-long antenna that lets you pick up a signal from more GPS satellites
ans: It improves the accuracy and precision of location measurements

que: About what is the accuracy for a handheld GPS (with DGPS and WAAS) you might go out and buy?
opt1: Meters horizontally, a few tens of meters vertically
opt2: Tens of meters horizontally, tens of meters vertically
ans: Meters horizontally, a few tens of meters vertically
